page.title: 16Tourism - Local concern.
page.content: The BBC series "Last of the Summer Wine" is filmed in the Holmfirth area. Holme village and the areas around the reservoirs have also been used as locations. Public interest in the programme has meant a huge increase in tourism. Coaches and carloads from all over the country travel to Holmfirth, many using the route over Holme Moss and through Holme village. This has greatly increased the traffic making the main road through the village very busy. "Holme Castle" is a small hotel standing at the edge of Holme village. The increase in tourists has resulted in new extensions being built and a number of houses in the village now offer "Bed and Breakfast". Local people are very concerned over this invasion.
